About Me

Electrical & Electronics Engineer | IoT Engineer @ sensors.AFRICA #CodeForAfrica | Full Stack Web Developer | Hydroponic Tech Enthusiast

I am on a lifelong journey to acquire knowledge and put it to good use. Every day is an opportunity to improve my life and the lives of those around me. With extensive experience in electrical engineering, IoT development, and web technologies, I bring a multidisciplinary approach to solving complex technical challenges.

Currently: Senior IoT Engineer at Code For Africa's sensors.AFRICA project. Passionate about air quality monitoring and sustainable technology solutions.

Professional Experience

A journey through my professional career in electronics engineering and web development

C4A

Senior IoT Engineer

Code For Africa · sensors.AFRICA

October 2021 - Present · 3+ years

Current

Leading the development of cutting-edge air-quality and noise monitoring sensors across Africa. Driving innovation in IoT infrastructure and establishing standardized environmental monitoring protocols for sustainable urban development.

Lead IoT sensor development and deployment across 15+ African cities
Implement CI/CD pipelines and improve system scalability by 300%
Review and optimize firmware, hardware schematics, and PCB designs
Train 50+ partners on sensor deployment and data management
Architect full-stack web applications for real-time environmental data
IoT Architecture Environmental Monitoring Data Analytics Team Leadership
ML

Electrical Engineer

Moderate Limited

August 2017 - October 2019 · 2+ years

Delivered comprehensive electrical engineering solutions, from system design to implementation. Managed electrical projects, client relationships, and team development while integrating modern web technologies for operational efficiency.

Led electrical department operations and supervised 15+ technicians
Designed and implemented electrical systems for 50+ commercial projects
Established preventive maintenance protocols reducing downtime by 40%
Trained teams on fire safety and electrical safety compliance
Developed web-based project management and database systems
Project Management System Design Team Leadership Web Development
KP

Engineering Intern

Kenya Power and Lighting Company

May 2016 - August 2016 · 4 months

Intensive hands-on experience in power systems across multiple Nairobi substations. Gained comprehensive knowledge in electrical operations, maintenance, construction, and system protection protocols.

Operations & Maintenance: transformer load balancing and fault diagnostics
Construction: power line installation and distribution system setup
System Protection: high voltage metering and relay programming
Electrical Plant: transformer maintenance and oil filtration systems
Power Systems High Voltage System Protection Maintenance
PT

Engineering Intern

Powergen Technologies Ltd

June 2015 - September 2015 · 4 months

Contributed to Kenya's Last-Mile electrification project, bringing power to underserved communities. Collaborated with KPLC to expand electrical infrastructure in Kibera, one of Africa's largest urban slums.

Installed 200+ prepaid meters for households in Kibera slums
Connected 150+ households to the national electrical grid
Maintained and upgraded low voltage distribution networks
Supported community engagement and technical training programs
Rural Electrification Community Impact Infrastructure Social Development
KAA

Engineering Intern

Kenya Airports Authority

May 2014 - September 2014 · 5 months

Maintained critical aviation infrastructure at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport. Worked with electrical and mechanical systems essential for safe airport operations and air traffic management.

Aviation Ground Lighting (AGL) systems maintenance and troubleshooting
Apron floodlighting and runway lighting system operations
PABX and VHF radio communication systems maintenance
Emergency systems: PA and crash alarm system operations
Backup power: diesel generator maintenance and testing
Aviation Systems Critical Infrastructure Communications Emergency Systems

My Approach & Values

The principles that guide my work and development philosophy

Quality First

I believe in writing clean, maintainable code that stands the test of time and scales with your business.

User-Centered

Every decision I make is guided by the end-user experience, ensuring intuitive and accessible interfaces.

Continuous Learning

Technology evolves rapidly, and I'm committed to staying current with the latest trends and best practices.

Let's Connect & Collaborate

I'm always excited to discuss new projects, opportunities, and innovative solutions in IoT and web development.
